meanings.definition: To increase the rating or value of something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to uprate her skills by taking additional courses.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to uprate the prices of their products next month.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to uprate the ordinary cards into magical ones.
meanings.sent4: His positive attitude uprated the team's morale during the challenging project.
meanings.sent5: The sun's warmth uprated the cozy feeling of the room.

meanings.definition: The act of adjusting or raising a rating or value.
meanings.sent1: The uprating of the antique vase made it more valuable to collectors.
meanings.sent2: The uprating of the movie led to more viewers attending the premiere.
meanings.sent3: The sudden uprating of the restaurant's rating left everyone pleasantly surprised.
meanings.sent4: The uprating of his performance evaluation brought a smile to his face.
meanings.sent5: The uprating of the house's worth was a pleasant surprise for the owners.
